dictToDot.py

00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 from xml.dom.minidom import parse, parseString, Node
00004 import sys
00005 import logging
00006 
00007 import osSpec
00008 import indsInterface
00009 
00010 ## Generates a DOT-language graph from an INDS deployment. It creates and uses
00011 # an indsInterface object to query the INDS server and build dictionaries for us to navigate.
00012 # Output is accumulated in the outputDot string for the caller/parent to save/parse/print.
00013 # Colors and such are pulled from the configuration file via the osSpec object instance.
00014 #
00015 # @file dictToDot.py
00016 # @author Paul Hubbard pfhubbar@ucsd.edu
00017 # @date 1/21/09
00018 # @todo Add URLs to nodes for multi-system graphs
00019 # @todo Handle more than one DataTurbine per graph
00020 
00021 ## Converts INDS dictionary into Graphviz DOT-language graph
00022 class dotMaker:
00023 
00024     ## Constructor just creates empty objects
00025     def __init__(self):
00026         outputDot = ''
00027         dt = ''
00028         colors = dict()
00029         edgeColors = dict()
00030         isStale = False
00031         
00032     # Variables
00033     ## This holds the entire output graph as a big string.
00034     outputDot = ''
00035     ## command ID for the DataTurbine instance
00036     dt = ''
00037     ## Node colors
00038     colors = dict()
00039     ## Edge colors
00040     edgeColors = dict()
00041     ## Has the XML config document changed?
00042     isStale = False
00043     
00044     # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00045     ## dictToDot uses indsInterface to get the commands and then generates the dot graph.
00046     def main(self):
00047         
00048         # Instantiate webservices interface class
00049         inds = indsInterface.indsInterface()
00050         
00051         logging.debug('Checking for changes in configuration...')
00052         # If command list is unchanged, just return
00053         self.isStale = inds.isStale()
00054         if self.isStale == True:
00055             return
00056         
00057         logging.debug('Loading colors from config file')
00058         # Load up graph colors from configuration file
00059         mc = osSpec.osSpec()
00060         self.colors = mc.colors
00061         self.edgeColors = mc.edgeColors
00062         
00063         logging.debug('Pull INDS and process into dictionary')
00064 
00065         # Read WS data, parse and create dictionaries
00066         inds.main()
00067         # Done with connection
00068         inds.close()        
00069     
00070         logging.debug('Processing sources...')
00071         
00072         # Start with graph definition
00073         self.addHeader()
00074         
00075         # First of all, we need the name of the data turbine server.
00076         # This quick search assumes there's only one in the system!
00077         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00078             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'server':
00079                 # To get name, we have to peek into the XML element name. Kinda weak.
00080                 if self.getElementName(inds.xml[x]) == 'dataTurbine':   
00081                     logging.info('DT name is %s' % x)           
00082                     self.dt = x
00083 
00084         # I've considered rolling this into a loop indexed by command type, but the
00085         # code started getting much harder to read and alter, so I'm leaving it unrolled.
00086         
00087         # Sources -> RBNB
00088         self.addOutput('edge [dir="tail", color="%s"]' % self.edgeColors['source'])
00089         
00090         # Do this in three passes - sources, servers and plugins
00091         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00092             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'source':
00093                 # UDP cap has another node to represent its listen port
00094                 # Again, we have to parse the XML to get the element name.
00095                 if self.getElementName(inds.xml[x]) == 'udpCapture':
00096                     # Define the port node
00097                     portNum = self.getInputPortnum(inds.xml[x])
00098                     portName = '%sport%s' % (x, portNum)
00099                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s" shape="box"]' % (portName, portNum))
00100                 
00101                     # Define the udpCapture node
00102                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00103                     (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00104                 
00105                     # Define the link from node -> udpCap
00106                     self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (portName, x))
00107 
00108                     # Define link from udp -> dt
00109                     self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (x, self.dt))
00110                 else:
00111                     # Handle all other sources uniformly
00112                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00113                     (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00114                     self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (x, self.dt))
00115 
00116         logging.debug('Processing servers...')
00117         self.addOutput('edge [dir="both", color="%s"]' % self.edgeColors['server'])
00118 
00119         # Next pass is servers
00120         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00121             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'server':         
00122                 # TimeDrive has a second node to denote its listening port
00123                 if self.getElementName(inds.xml[x]) == 'timeDrive':
00124                     # define the port node
00125                     portNum = self.getInputPortnum(inds.xml[x])
00126                     portName = '%sport%s' % (x, portNum)
00127                 
00128                     # Node for port
00129                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", shape="box"]' % (portName, portNum))
00130                 
00131                     # Node for timeDrive
00132                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00133                     (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00134                 
00135                     # Define link from port to timeDrive
00136                     self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (portName, x))
00137 
00138                     # And from TD to dataTurbine
00139                     self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (self.dt, x))
00140                 else:
00141                         
00142                     self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00143                     (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00144             
00145                     if inds.niceName[x] == 'tomcat':
00146                         self.addOutput('%s -> %s', self.dt, x)
00147 
00148         self.addOutput('edge [color="%s"]' % self.edgeColors['plugin'])
00149         
00150         logging.debug('Plugins...')     
00151         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00152             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'plugin':             
00153                 self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color=%s]' % \
00154                 (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00155 
00156                 self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (self.dt, x))
00157 
00158         self.addOutput('edge [color="%s"]' % self.edgeColors['converter'])
00159 
00160         logging.debug('converters...')
00161         # xmldemux, csvdemux
00162         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00163             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'converter':
00164                 self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00165                 (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00166 
00167                 self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (self.dt, x))
00168 
00169         logging.debug('Sinks...')
00170         # Pure sinks - presently unused, so edge output is unused and harmless.
00171         self.addOutput('edge [dir="head", color="%s"]' % self.edgeColors['sink'])
00172 
00173         for x in inds.cmdIds:
00174             if inds.cmdType[x] == 'sink':
00175                 self.addOutput('%s [label="%s", URL="%s", color="%s"]' % \
00176                 (x, inds.niceName[x], inds.getInfoUrl(x), self.colors[inds.cmdType[x]]))
00177 
00178                 self.addOutput('%s -> %s' % (self.dt, x))
00179             
00180         # All other types - add here as required
00181         logging.debug('All cmd IDs processed!') 
00182         
00183         self.addFooter()
00184     
00185     # End of main routine #######################################################
00186         
00187     ## Parse XML and dig out port number here... Assumes child node named 'input' with
00188     # port attribute inside.
00189     def getInputPortnum(self, cmdXml):
00190         # Parse XML into DOM
00191         dom = parseString(cmdXml)
00192         
00193         # Point to root node to start search
00194         node = dom.documentElement
00195 
00196         # Initialize just in case search fails
00197         portNum = 0
00198 
00199         # Searching child nodes for one named 'input'
00200         for child in node.childNodes:
00201             if child.nodeName == 'input':
00202                 for (name, value) in child.attributes.items():
00203                     if name == 'port':
00204                         portNum = value
00205             
00206         dom.unlink()
00207         return portNum
00208         
00209     ## Parse XML and return element name
00210     def getElementName(self, cmdXml):
00211         dom = parseString(cmdXml)
00212 
00213         foo = dom.documentElement.tagName
00214 
00215         dom.unlink()
00216         return foo
00217                     
00218     ## Append a string to the output, plus newline character
00219     def addOutput(self, outStr):
00220         self.outputDot += outStr
00221         self.outputDot += '\n'
00222 
00223     ## Graph definition.
00224     # @todo Make graph/digraph a parameter
00225     # @todo Make graph name a parameter
00226     def addHeader(self):
00227         self.addOutput("digraph INDS {")
00228         self.addOutput('center="true"')
00229         self.addOutput('ratio="auto"')
00230         self.addOutput('orientation="portrait"')
00231         self.addOutput('rankdir="LR"')
00232         self.addOutput('size="8,10.5"')
00233         
00234     ## Graph footer - just close definition 
00235     def addFooter(self):
00236         self.addOutput('}')
00237             
00238     ## PRint graph to stdout        
00239     def dumpDot(self):
00240         print self.outputDot
00241 
00242 ## Test harness 
00243 if __name__ == '__main__':      
00244     logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, \
00245                         format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s')
00246     try:
00247         md = dotMaker()
00248         md.main()
00249     
00250         logging.debug(md.outputDot)
00251     except BaseException, e:
00252         logging.exception(e)
